metadata.title: CVE-2018-20784 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 4.20.2, kernel/sched/fair.c mishandles leafcfs_rq's, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (infiniteloop in update_blocked_averages) or possibly have unspecified other impactby inducing a high load.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-170-generic - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-170-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-170-lowlatency - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-170-generic - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-170-lowlatency - 4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1059-aws - 4.4.0-1059.63
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-170.199~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1059.63').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
